content: On October 18, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Minnesota Twins in Game 3 of the World Series at the Metrodome in Minneapolis. The game is remembered for the incredible pitching duel between Braves' ace Tom Glavine and Twins' starter Scott Erickson, with Glavine throwing eight scoreless innings. The Braves won the game 3-2, marking a crucial moment in the series as they were able to take the lead in the tightly contested matchup that ultimately went seven games.
